review: It appears Amazon has taken its cues from Apple TV in creating the Fire TV, and then taking it a few steps ahead. In design, navigation and ease of use, in my opinion, Apple TV still has an edge over the Fire TV (hence the 4 star rating). The Fire TV's build quality is about as good as the Apple TV, which is to say, excellent. Where the Fire TV has Apple TV beat is the sheer volume of supported Apps, including music, video, lifestyle and gaming. The voice search facility works well most of the time.While Apple TV is tightly integrated into Apple's iTunes ecosystem, Amazon's Fire TV is integrated into Amazon's ecosystem, where purchased movies, music and other content can be streamed on demand.Using the optical out (Toslink) connection, the audio quality is excellent. The video quality is excellent too, but here again the Apple TV has a slight edge. The colors from the Apple TV seem to have an extra "pop", but that is nit picking.Most people these days seem to be invested in both Amazon's and Apple's ecosystems for their online entertainment content.Therefore, in choosing between the Apple TV and Fire TV, I would say get both if you can afford them! Otherwise, the Fire TV would be better simply because of the volume of applications (including Spotify Connect, with Apple TV does not support) and functionality.
